edu.kit.informatik.matchthree.framework.interfaces

Interface Move


  • public interface Move
    A move that can be applied to a Board.
    Author:
    IPD Koziolek

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void apply(Board board)
      Applies the move to the given board.
      boolean canBeApplied(Board board)
      Determines whether the move can be applied to the given Board in respect to the dimensions of the board.
      java.util.Set<Position> getAffectedPositions(Board board)
      Returns all positions on the given board that are affected by this move.
      Move reverse()
      Returns a new Move that is the reverse of this move.

    • Method Detail

      • canBeApplied

        boolean canBeApplied(Board board)
        Determines whether the move can be applied to the given Board in respect to the dimensions of the board.
        Parameters:
        board - the board to test
        Returns:
        true iff the move can be applied to the given board.

      • apply

        void apply(Board board)
        Applies the move to the given board.
        Parameters:
        board - the board to apply this move to.
        Throws:
        BoardDimensionException - if the move cannot be applied to the given board

      • reverse

        Move reverse()
        Returns a new Move that is the reverse of this move.

        The notion of "reverse" is explained on the task sheet.

        Returns:
        a reverse move to this move.

      • getAffectedPositions

        java.util.Set<Position> getAffectedPositions(Board board)
        Returns all positions on the given board that are affected by this move.
        Parameters:
        board - the board this move is to be applied to
        Returns:
        a set of all positions that are affected by this move
        Throws:
        BoardDimensionException - if the move cannot be applied to the given board
